actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 49.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 49 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 to prohibit the use of funds from being made available to pay the salary and expenses of Antony Blinken.
On agreeing to the Ogles amendment; Agreed to by voice vote.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Ogles amendment No. 48.
An amendment, offered by Mr. Ogles,  numbered 48 printed in Part B of House Report 118-559 to prohibit the use of funds to delist the People's Republic of China from the "Majors List".
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8771 â€” "Making appropriations for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Thompson of PA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal. Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Mary E. Miller to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
